job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: <p><strong>Why Coil?</strong></p><p>Coil&nbsp;makes it easy for creators to monetize content on the web without using ads or collecting user data.</p><p><br></p><p>All a creator needs to do is embed a special monetization meta tag with their payment details into their website. When a Coil member visits the site, our extension checks for the presence of the monetization meta tag and starts sending a continuous stream of micropayments to the creator.</p><p><br></p><p>This is based on an open standard called&nbsp;Web Monetization. At Coil, our goal is to bring users to the Web Monetization ecosystem so creators can make money off of their content. We want to give creators a chance to be fairly paid for their content directly by those who consume it, without resorting to pushing ads or selling out to a large content aggregator.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Our Ideal Candidate</strong></p><ul><li>Is excited about Web Monetization</li><li>Thrives working in fast moving startup environment</li><li>Desires to be part of a small and creative team</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>As a Site Reliability Engineer you will</strong></p><ul><li>Design, develop and iterate Chaos Engineering practices, disaster recovery protocol, and run books etc.</li><li>Debug production issues across all services and levels of the stack.</li><li>Monitor and proactively address symptoms rather than solely addressing outages.</li><li>Implement and educate the team on best practices for monitoring, observability, and reliability.</li><li>Build tooling and automation to reduce toil.</li><li>Lead improvements to our CI/CD pipeline allowing us to ship code faster with confidence.</li><li>Work with engineering to improve the developer experience.</li><li>Mentor and assist team members on how to build reliable, maintainable infrastructure.</li><li>Collaborate with the team to determine which features to build and how to architect them.</li><li>Perform code reviews.</li><li>Be part of the on-call engineering rotation.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>What you bring to the table</strong></p><ul><li>2-3 years of professional working experience.</li><li>Track record of building and maintaining performant micro service oriented software products.</li><li>Know how to build resilience and durability into cloud infrastructure.</li><li>Know the ins and outs of Kubernetes.</li><li>Knowledgeable about Node.js and are up for working in Typescript.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to proactively manage tasks, project, and issues.</li><li>Outstanding all-round communication skills and ability to work collaboratively.</li><li>Experience leading projects to improve infrastructure and building a team from scratch to support the growth of the organization.</li><li>Leadership and communication skills.</li><li>Authorization to work in the U.S.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Pluses</strong></p><ul><li>Extensive experience with major cloud providers (GCP, AWS, Azure).</li><li>Experience scaling micro services architecture to handle large loads.</li><li>Experience with Kubernetes, Terraform, Helm, Docker at scale.</li><li>Background in building payout infrastructure or content platforms.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to create custom slack emojis.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Location</strong></p><p>Coil has offices in San Francisco and Cape Town and remote employees and contractors in the US and abroad. This full-time role is located in our San Francisco headquarters, but can be done remotely from anywhere in North America provided that your availability includes Coil’s core business hours of 9 am to 3 pm PT.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p><strong>About Coil</strong></p><p>Coil was founded in 2018 to build a better business model for the Web. Coil makes it easy for publishers and creators to monetize their content across the internet, and provides an alternative to advertising and site-by-site subscription models. As Coil Members enjoy content, Coil uses a proposed open web standard called Web Monetization to stream micropayments to creators in real time. In 2019, Coil, in collaboration with Mozilla and Creative Commons, launched the&nbsp;$100 million Grant for the Web&nbsp;to boost open, fair and inclusive standards and innovation in Web Monetization. Coil also invested $20 million in Imgur, the community-powered entertainment platform reaching 300 million people each month.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><p>- Platinum health coverage with no premiums for employees and 75% of premiums paid for dependents</p><p>- Dental and Vision insurance with no premiums for employees</p><p>- 401(k) with matching</p><p>- Stock option plan</p><p>- Gym / Fitness Studio benefits</p><p>- Paid Family Leave</p><p>- Flexible Vacation</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Coil is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.</strong></p>
